intro: Melolobium alpinum, commonly known as the alpine melolobium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are trifoliate, meaning they consist of three leaflets, and it produces small, pod-like fruits. Melolobium alpinum is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
